basics.name: Andrew Chang
basics.label: Security Professional
basics.summary: Experienced cybersecurity professional with a strong track record in cloud security architecture, identity and access management (IAM), and penetration testing. Passionate about actively contributing to the cybersecurity community through the development of cutting-edge security tools and methodologies to assess cloud and IAM configurations.

education.institution: Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA
Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA
courses: Specialization in Systems and Architecture and Information Internetworks
RoboJackets Robot Sumo Team Software Lead

experience.name: Praetorian Security, Inc.
highlights: Leading penetration tests and configuration reviews against cloud environments and applications for external clients; 3,500+ billable hours and >10 critical/high findings
Delivering strategic recommendations to key stakeholders regarding the security posture of their digital infrastructure and assets; >9.5 Net Promoter Score.
Developing new methodology and tools to assess cloud and IAM configurations.
Supporting sales discovery calls as a subject matter expert.
Providing guidance for junior engineers to solidify their offensive security foundations.

experience.name: Cisco Systems, Inc.
highlights: Performed offensive security engagements for external clients; 4,500+ billable hours.
Developed and maintained Python framework to automate triage of vulnerability scanner alerts in backbone network fabric for Fortune 15 information technology company. ~30k LoC.

experience.name: Georgia Institute of Technology - Institute of Security and Privacy
highlights: Developed labs and exams for brand new CS 6264 – System and Network Defenses online graduate course for the top ranked cybersecurity program in the country.
Labs included: binary exploitation, end-point security with kernel hooks, and Android WebView phishing attacks.

experience.name: Georgia Institute of Technology - Office of Information Technology
experience.summary: Analyzed and triaged security alerts raised by campus endpoint monitoring systems by crafting searches in Splunk, FireEye HX, and other in-house solutions.

projects.name: AzureHound
projects.summary: Extension to existing AzureHound project to enumerate Azure subscription RBAC roles, RBAC role assignments, and service principal assignments. Written in Go, ~4k LoC.
highlights: Microsoft Entra ID
Microsoft Azure
Identity and Access Management (IAM)
Go

projects.name: ScentTrail
projects.summary: Command-line utility to extend an existing Bloodhound Neo4j graph database to identify vertical privilege escalation based on Azure RBAC permissions. Written in Python and Neo4j, ~1k LoC.
highlights: Microsoft Entra ID
Microsoft Azure
Identity and Access Management (IAM)
Python
Neo4j

certifications.name: Certified AWS Cloud Red Team Specialist
Google Cloud Certified Professional Cloud Security Engineer

publications.name: Azure RBAC Privilege Escalations: Azure VM
publications.summary: Authored article covering covering four methods attackers can use to escalate privileges in Azure subscriptions by leveraging their Azure VM permissions.

publications.name: Why Azure B2C ROPC Custom Flows Are Inherently Insecure
publications.summary: Authored article investigating the default Azure B2C ROPC flow used for token issuance. Specifically, the flow could be abused by creating authorization tokens with arbitrary scopes.

publications.name: Mnemosyne: An Effective and Efficient Postmortem Watering Hole Attack Investigation System (CCS ’20)
publications.summary: Contributed to research in the detection and investigation of watering-hole attacks against frequently-visited websites. The forensic analysis engine developed as part of this research was a lightweight browser-modification-free auditing daemon that reduced the amount of manual analysis required by the forensic analyst by about 98%.

involvements.summary: Steering Committee member responsible for communications to the NTC membership.
highlights: Creating monthly newsletters
Leading onboarding meetings to generate interest in the NTC
Developing pilot for open-source membership management solution
Contributed to dues payments website development

involvements.summary: Operated a cryptography workshop for a children's ethical hacking conference.
highlights: Led workshop during the conference
Developed worksheets to teach basic cryptography concepts to children ages K-12

involvements.organization: Georgia Institute of Technology – Institute of Privacy and Security
involvements.summary: Research assistant for Dr. Wenke Lee's GTISC lab (now the Georgia Tech School of Cybersecurity and Privacy)
highlights: Developed a browser-based auditing approach for watering hole-based cyber-attacks by overcoming limitations relating to recording necessary semantic information instead of just viewing system calls
